steps.title: Before a bovine is butchered, it must be slaughtered.
steps.content: Before a bovine is butchered, it must be slaughtered. Please see How to Slaughter Cattle for steps on how you can humanely and properly slaughter your cattle.

steps.title: Start the butchering process.
steps.content: Start the butchering process. After the carcass has been hung for a few days to a few weeks, it is time to cut the carcass halves up into different pieces. Make sure you have the proper equipment, knives sharpened, and clean clothes and an apron before you begin.

steps.title: Quarter the carcass.
steps.content: Quarter the carcass. Cut between the 12th and 13th rib, first slicing with a large pointed knife and then cutting the top from the bottom with a meat saw. This cross-section of the cut should look like a rib eye steak. [1] X Trustworthy Source Food and Agricultural Organization of the United Nations Specialized agency of the United Nations responsible for leading international efforts to end world hunger and improve nutrition Go to source

steps.title: Attach a gambrel to the lower half or use chains to hang these quarters from a hook.
steps.content: Attach a gambrel to the lower half or use chains to hang these quarters from a hook. Or, set both halves on a table at a comfortable level. Begin cutting the meat at the hind end of the carcass.

steps.title: Cut off each leg with a meat saw.
steps.content: Cut off each leg with a meat saw. You will begin at the hip and move down to the tailbone. Cut across the top to create round steaks, or cut larger portions for roasts. [2] X Research source The meatiest end of the leg is the rump roast. Cut it away from the bone or leave the bone in when you remove it.

steps.title: Remove the flank steaks from the side of the carcass.
steps.content: Remove the flank steaks from the side of the carcass. This is the muscle to the side of the belly portion. Trim away any large amounts of fat. Set your flank steaks on a table and save your fat in a pile to use for pure rendered fat, if you choose. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the sirloin flat meat.
steps.content: Remove the sirloin flat meat. Remove the fat with a sharp knife and cut into sirloin steaks of any size. You can also cut this flat meat into pieces for fajitas or tri-tip steak meat.

steps.title: Cut away the meat beneath the backbone, otherwise known as tenderloin or fillet mignon.
steps.content: Cut away the meat beneath the backbone, otherwise known as tenderloin or fillet mignon. You can leave it intact or cut it into smaller steaks.

steps.title: Choose whether you want to cut the meat from the ribs with a knife or use a meat saw to leave the bone in on your rib steaks.
steps.content: Choose whether you want to cut the meat from the ribs with a knife or use a meat saw to leave the bone in on your rib steaks. You can also choose to use the area between the 6th and 12th ribs for a large prime rib roast.

steps.title: Cut your steaks from the rear (just after the rump roast) forward.
steps.content: Cut your steaks from the rear (just after the rump roast) forward. They are sirloin, porterhouse, T-bone and New York strip.

steps.title: Remove meat that is left on this part of the carcass and use it for ground beef or stew meat.
steps.content: Remove meat that is left on this part of the carcass and use it for ground beef or stew meat.

steps.title: Begin butchering the front section.
steps.content: Begin butchering the front section. Lift the leg up and cut beneath the shoulder blade until the leg comes loose from the body.

steps.title: Remove the meat on the shoulder.
steps.content: Remove the meat on the shoulder. This is called a blade roast.

steps.title: Remove the top part of the leg.
steps.content: Remove the top part of the leg. This is called chuck. It can be used as a roast or steaks with the bone in or out. The lower portion of meat should be used for ground beef or steaks.

steps.title: Remove the meat from the front of the leg.
steps.content: Remove the meat from the front of the leg. This is your brisket. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the neck meat and put it with the other stew meat.
steps.content: Remove the neck meat and put it with the other stew meat.

steps.title: Cut off the lower ribs to be used as short ribs.
steps.content: Cut off the lower ribs to be used as short ribs.

steps.title: Cure your meat in a brine if you would choose.
steps.content: Cure your meat in a brine if you would choose. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Make ground beef or sausages with a meat grinder.
steps.content: Make ground beef or sausages with a meat grinder. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap your meat separately in plastic and paper.
steps.content: Wrap your meat separately in plastic and paper.

steps.title: Place the meat in your freezer or in your refrigerator if you plan to use it quickly.
steps.content: Place the meat in your freezer or in your refrigerator if you plan to use it quickly. [7] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source
